Add MockOdbGatewayService

Extract a common interface from ObdGatewayService and put it to AbstractGatewayService.
With this refactoring add the MockObdGatwayService which will be used when no BT
device or BT connectivity is present and help in debugging the application.

Also, run executeQueue in a different thread than the UI-thread in order to stop
'too much work on main thread' from appearing.
Remove binding service code from onResume

Do not attempt to Establish Bluetooth connection if no Bluetooth device ...
prevent onCreate call on orientation change

Merge pull request #56 from nomwerp/master

Prevent onCreate call on orientation change

set isRunning at the start of startObdConnection instead of at very end to prevent multiple threads being started while it is being executed, stopService will already set it to false in case something goes wrong

Unbind service if failed to connect by throwing around exceptions if something goes wrong in startService() and startObdConnection() and doing an explicit doUnbindService when catching them, otherwise isServiceBound will still be true and no attempt at restarting service will be made.
this fixes issue where if can't connect to OBD device when for example device is not in range and connection times out only the first time that 'start live data' is pressed a connection is attempted, making it impossible to connect if first attempt fails.
fix wording of log message

Merge pull request #57 from nomwerp/master

Fixes issue where impossible to connect to OBD device if first attempt fails.

applied some threading love.

AbstractGatewayService.java: instead of (potentially) starting a new executeQueue thread every time queueJob is called, only start it _once_ in onCreate and more
importantly have it interrupted by onDestroy. this means a new thread is started when service is created and asked nicely to stop when service is destroyed
(Mock)ObdGatewayService.java: try to handle the thread interruption by bailing out when thread is interrupted and catching InterruptedException (and re-throwing it),
no need for isQueueRunning flag anymore.
This resolves issue where multiple executeQueue threads are reading from stream at same time resulting in garbage out. in theory it should only have started new
thread when none is running and stopped when the queue was empty but this is wasn't always working. also no need to stop the thread when queue is empty it will
happily sit and wait for it to be refilled again so we can just have one thread.

Merge pull request #58 from nomwerp/master

Applied some threading love. Fixes #40

Move detection of hardware from onCreate to onResume, otherwise we'll never know if bluetooth got enabled while paused.
This is a very common scenario: app is started with bluetooth disabled, pause, enable bluetooth, resume, app still thinks bluetooth is disabled.
onResume gets called onCreate anyway so still works on first start.
also none of this interferes with live data collection in background, will happily continue when resumed
improve Bluetooth notification texts
reformat previous commits

Merge pull request #2 from pires/master

rebase

* add status of GPS and Bluetooth (towards pires/android-obd-reader#5 )
* reformatting xml
* re-organised layout to get status fields (gps, bt, etc) at bottom
* try to make sense of GPS status
* removed mGpsStatus since was never used
* removed the last couple of Toasts in favor of updating the status (since we also have dialogs)
* move gpsInit() from OnCreate() to OnResume() to catch case if gps has been enabled while paused
* fixed wording and typo in dialogs
* improved main layout

still needs more work in capturing all status changes

remove the ObdResetCommand from list off commands to run (and listed in preferences) ,since reset is already called in startObdConnection() and when called again without the other init commands such as EchoOffObdCommand() and LineFeedOffObdCommand() results in 'UNABLE TO CONNECT' response from all commands issued after.

Update AndroidManifest.xml

before tagging 2.0-rc1 the version name needs to include -rc1 since this name will be displayed in for example f-droid . we don't want it to show as 'Version 2.0'  but rather 'Version 2.0-rc1'

also bumped the version code for sanity
